summary: This document is an email chain discussing a public dispute between Prince Andrew and the FBI/U.S. Attorney's office regarding his cooperation in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. It includes commentary from legal experts and media reports about the conflicting claims.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: The Duke of York who publicly stated he is ready to talk to the FBI but claims he hasn't been approached, while U.S. authorities claim they have made several attempts to contact his representatives.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier whose alleged sexual abuse is being investigated; the context for why authorities are seeking Prince Andrew's cooperation.

persons.name: Berman
persons.context: The prosecutor who called out Prince Andrew for giving 'zero co-operation' to the Epstein investigation at a press conference.

persons.name: Duncan Levin
persons.role: Former federal and New York state prosecutor
persons.context: Legal expert quoted by The Daily Beast who commented on the unusual nature of a prosecutor publicly calling out a witness and the determination to investigate Epstein's network.

connections.description: Prince Andrew is a potential witness in the investigation into Epstein's alleged sexual abuse, indicating some prior association.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is seeking Prince Andrew's cooperation in the Epstein investigation and publicly criticized his lack of cooperation.

events.title: Berman's press conference criticizing Prince Andrew
events.description: U.S. Attorney Berman held a press conference outside Epstein's former residence, calling out Prince Andrew by name for giving 'zero co-operation' to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Media reports on Prince Andrew-FBI dispute
events.description: Multiple news outlets reported on the conflicting claims between Prince Andrew (saying he's ready to talk but hasn't been approached) and U.S. authorities (claiming they've made several attempts to contact him).

locations: Manhattan (referenced as jurisdiction of U.S. Attorney's office)
Epstein's infamous front door (location of Berman's press conference)
keyFacts: Prince Andrew publicly claimed he was ready to talk to the FBI but hadn't been approached, contradicting U.S. authorities' claims that they had made several attempts to contact his representatives.
U.S. Attorney Berman took the rare step of publicly calling out Prince Andrew by name for giving 'zero co-operation' to the Epstein investigation.
Legal expert Duncan Levin noted the highly unusual nature of a prosecutor making public statements about a witness's reluctance to cooperate, emphasizing this case is not typical.
The dispute occurred in February 2020, showing ongoing investigative efforts regarding Epstein's network after his death in August 2019.
